docs.title: List of Machine Types

docs.text: Installation ¶ Onepanel CLI is available on pypi and works on Windows, MacOS and Linux. To install Onepanel's CLI via pip : pip install -U onepanel Note CLI is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel's Workspaces. Tip The CLI is compatible with Python 2.7.x and Python >= 3.6.x, if you have both versions installed, you will need to use pip3 for Python >= 3.6.x. Connect your account ¶ You can connect your Onepanel account to CLI by using the login command where you'll be prompted for your email and password: onepanel login Alternatively, you can create an "access token" as shown below: Your browser does not support the video tag. And then login as follows: onepanel login -t <access-token> Checking version ¶ onepanel --version Help and documentation ¶ You can add --help to any command to view information about its syntax and options, some examples: onepanel jobs --help onepanel jobs create --help
docs.title: Onepanel CLI

docs.text: Onepanel CLI is available on pypi and works on Windows, MacOS and Linux. To install Onepanel's CLI via pip : pip install -U onepanel Note CLI is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel's Workspaces. Tip The CLI is compatible with Python 2.7.x and Python >= 3.6.x, if you have both versions installed, you will need to use pip3 for Python >= 3.6.x.

docs.text: You can connect your Onepanel account to CLI by using the login command where you'll be prompted for your email and password: onepanel login Alternatively, you can create an "access token" as shown below: Your browser does not support the video tag. And then login as follows: onepanel login -t <access-token>
